courseContents.title: BRS_001AA
courseContents.description:
Ramkumar & Co. is engaged in the textile business and they have recently appointed a part-qualified accountant. The cashbook of Ramkumar & Co. showed a bank overdraft balance of ₹122000/- on December 31st 2022. Upon comparing it with the passbook the following differences were noted:


Sl. No.Transactions
1An insurance premium of ₹16600 has been paid by the bank as per standing instructions but has not yet been recorded in the cash book.
2On December 28th cheques totalling ₹60000 were issued of which only ₹4000 was encashed by December 31st.
3Cheques amounting to ₹6500 have been paid to the bank for collection. Out of these only ₹2000 have been credited to the passbook.
4The bank charged ₹2500 as interest on the overdraft but intimation of this charge has not been received yet.
5The bank collected ₹2800 directly with respect to interest on investments.
6A cheque for ₹10200 has been debited in the bank column of the cashbook but it was not sent to the bank at all.

questions.question: Cheque for ₹202,000 was recorded in the cash book but not in the bank statement. (Add or Less?)
Cheque issued for ₹15,000 but not yet presented for payment. (Add or Less?)
Bank charges of ₹500 recorded only in the passbook. (Add or Less?)
Direct deposit by customers of ₹50,000 recorded in the passbook but not in the cash book. (Add or Less?)
Dividend of ₹3,500 received by the bank but not recorded in the cash book. (Add or Less?)

courseContents.title: BRS_022AVT
courseContents.description:
You are required to prepare a bank reconciliation statement for the month of December 2022. The cash book showed a debit balance of ₹250,000. The following differences were noted:


Sl. No.Transactions
1The passbook showed bank charges of ₹12,500 debited by the bank.
2One of the debtors deposited ₹475,000 in the firm's bank account on December 20th, but it was not recorded in the cash book.
3Sarita Sharma, a customer, directly deposited ₹45,200 into the bank.
4Electricity charges of ₹5,500 were paid through the bank.
5Processing fee of ₹12,000 for the term loan was charged by the bank.
6A cheque for ₹64,300 was issued but not yet presented for payment.

questions.question: Bank charges of ₹12,500 debited by the bank. (Add or Less?)
Debtor deposit of ₹475,000 not recorded in cash book. (Add or Less?)
Sarita Sharma deposit of ₹45,200 directly into the bank. (Add or Less?)
Electricity charges of ₹5,500 paid through the bank. (Add or Less?)
Processing fee of ₹12,000 for the term loan charged by the bank. (Add or Less?)
Cheque for ₹64,300 issued but not yet presented for payment. (Add or Less?)

courseContents.title: BRS_021AUT
courseContents.description:
You are required to prepare a bank reconciliation statement for the month of July 2022. The cash book showed a debit balance of ₹135,000. The following differences were noted:


Sl. No.Transactions
1The passbook showed bank charges of ₹2,500 debited by the bank.
2A dividend of ₹3,000 was collected by the bank but not recorded in the cashbook.
3Vimal Tiwari, a customer, directly deposited ₹25,000 into the bank.
4Processing fee of ₹8,000 for the term loan charged by the bank.
5Electricity charges of ₹10,300 were paid through the bank.
6A cheque for ₹18,500 was issued but not yet presented for payment.

questions.question: Bank charges of ₹2,500 debited by the bank. (Add or Less?)
Dividend of ₹3,000 collected by the bank but not recorded in the cashbook. (Add or Less?)
Vimal Tiwari deposit of ₹25,000 directly into the bank. (Add or Less?)
Processing fee of ₹8,000 for the term loan charged by the bank. (Add or Less?)
Electricity charges of ₹10,300 paid through the bank. (Add or Less?)
Cheque for ₹18,500 issued but not yet presented for payment. (Add or Less?)

courseContents.title: BRS_002AB
courseContents.description:
You are required to prepare a bank reconciliation statement for the month of April 2023. The cash book showed a credit balance of ₹84,000. The following differences were noted:


Sl. No.Transactions
1The passbook showed bank interest of ₹1,800 credited by the bank.
2A cheque deposit of ₹10,000 was recorded in the cash book but not yet reflected in the passbook.
3Processing fee of ₹2,500 charged by the bank.
4A dividend of ₹4,000 collected by the bank but not recorded in the cash book.
5A cheque for ₹7,500 issued but not yet presented for payment.

questions.question: Bank interest of ₹1,800 credited by the bank. (Add or Less?)
Cheque deposit of ₹10,000 not yet reflected in the passbook. (Add or Less?)
Processing fee of ₹2,500 charged by the bank. (Add or Less?)
Dividend of ₹4,000 collected by the bank but not recorded in the cash book. (Add or Less?)
Cheque for ₹7,500 issued but not yet presented for payment. (Add or Less?)

courseContents.title: BRS_004AD
courseContents.description:
XYZ Ltd. requires you to prepare a bank reconciliation statement for the month of February 2023. The cash book showed a debit balance of ₹60,000. The following differences were noted:


Sl. No.Transactions
1Bank charges of ₹1,200 were debited from the passbook but not recorded in the cash book.
2A cheque deposit of ₹15,000 was recorded in the cash book but not yet reflected in the passbook.
3A dividend of ₹2,500 was collected by the bank but not recorded in the cash book.
4A cheque for ₹5,500 was issued but not yet presented for payment.
5Processing fee of ₹750 was charged by the bank.
